title: `Mask::<_,_>::splat(false)` breaks `#![feature(generic_arg_infer)]`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
We added a new feature to the Portable SIMD API! ```rust Simd::break_compiler(); ``` Yes, that's right: we can now break the compiler 4 times faster! ### Code ```Rust #![feature(portable_simd)] #![feature(generic_arg_infer)] use std::simd::{Mask}; fn main() { let y = Mask::<_, _>::splat(false); } ``` ### Meta I first discovered this on rustc 1.58.0-nightly (b416e3892 2021-11-13) but it remains an issue currently: `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.59.0-nightly (e2116acae 2021-12-05) binary: rustc commit-hash: e2116acae59654bfab2a9729a024f3e2fd6d4b02 commit-date: 2021-12-05 host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc release: 1.59.0-nightly LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` PS C:\Users\${name}\project> rustc -O test_mask.rs thread 'rustc' panicked at 'not yet implemented', compiler\rustc_typeck\src\astconv\mod.rs:462:29 stack backtrace: error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: note: rustc 1.58.0-nightly (b416e3892 2021-11-13) running on x86_64-pc-windows-msvc query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `main` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
Backtrace

```powershell PS C:\Users\${name}\project> rustc -O test_mask.rs thread 'rustc' panicked at 'not yet implemented', compiler\rustc_typeck\src\astconv\mod.rs:462:29 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff9a3ec8c6f -
